question.text: Phagocytosis may be characterized by which of the following statements?

options.text: It involves fluid uptake by small vesicles
It is important in digestive processes in mammals
It involves the uptake of cellular debris in large endocytic vesicles.

solution.text:
The immune cells like macrophages have the ability to "eat" or "devour" pathogenic cells by ingesting them. This process of cell-eating is called phagocytosis. Phagocytosis can be defined as a process to ingest of engulf other cells or particles. The ingested particle is surrounded by a vesicle called endocytic vesicles that help in digestion.

Phagocytosis is a type of endocytosis. If a cell takes is fluid substances making endocytic vesicle is called pinocytosis.
